comment: Export to JSON plugin for PHPMyAdmin

data.question: CSS was first proposed by?
Haakon Wium Lie introduced Css on October 10, ______.
he became co-author of CSS1, and is regarded as co-creator of CSS.
True or False SGML stands for Standard Generalized Markup Language
True or False CSS was developed to provide style sheets for the web
True or False One requirement for a web style sheet language was for style sheets to come from different sources on the web.
True or False Existing style sheet languages like DSSSL and FOSI were  suitable.
What does DSSSL Stands for?
data.answer: Document Style Semantics and Specification Language

data.question: What does SGML Stands for?
Is a style sheet language for SGML and, later.
What does FOSI stands for?
_______ - was developed by the US Department of Defense to control the pagination and layout of SGML and XML technical data.
True or False FOSI style sheets are themselves written in SGML
it is a set of instructions to a web browser on how to display various elements on a web page
What CSS stands for?
___________ - Are just text files, or text embedded in the head of an html document, that help separate content from appearance.
True or False The content of a page goes into an HTML file. And the appearance goes into style sheet.
it is the part of a statement which identifies page elements, normally the HTML element you want to style
The part of a statement which tells a browser how selected elements should be drawn

h1 {
   colorblue; font-size12px;
}
In the example above, the h1 is the ____

h1 {
  color:blue; font-size:12px;
}
In the example above, the 'color' & 'font-style' is an example of a ____
CSS declarations always end with the symbol _
True or False: CSS declaration groups are surrounded by curly brackets ({})
All Property need to have its _____
_______ - Loses many of the advantage of style sheets by mixing content with presentation. Use this method sparingly such as when  a style is to be applied to a single occurrence of an element.
______ ____ _____ - Should be used when a single document has a unique style, usually they are declared in the head section by using style tag
______ ____ _____ - Is an ideal method when the style is applied to many pages.

An _______ ____ _____ allows changes on the look of an entire web site by changing one file. Each page must link to the style sheet using the <link> tag the browser will read the style definitions from the file
True or False: Every statement must have a selector and a declaration.
True or False: The declaration comes immediately after the selector and contain by a pair of semicolon.
True or False: The declaration is one or more properties separated by semicolons. ( ;)
True or False: each property has a property name followed by a colon
This Css property Sets all the background properties in one declaration
This CSS Property Sets whether a background image is fixed or scrolls with the rest of the page
This CSS property Specifies the painting area of the background
This CSS Property Sets the background color of an element
This CSS Property Sets the background image for an element
This CSS Property Specifies where the background image(s) is/are positioned
This CSS Properties Sets the starting position of a background image
True or False: The border-style property can have from one to four values (for the top border, right border, bottom border, and the left border)
True or False: The border-width property can have from one to eight values
A _________ is something that explains the relationship between the selectors.
A ___ ______ can contain more than one simple selector. Between the simple selectors, we can include a combinator.
There are four different combinators in CSS, Give all
data.answer: descendant selector,child selector,adjacent sibling selector,general sibling selector

data.question: The ________ ______ matches all elements that are descendants of a specified element.
The _______ ____ selects all elements that are the children of a specified element.
The ______ _____ ___ selects all elements that are the adjacent siblings of a specified element.
The ______ ______ ____ selects all elements that are siblings of a specified element.
this selector is used to select the element that is the nth child, of a particular type, of its parent.
________ is used in millions of Web pages to improve the design, validate forms, detect browsers, create cookies, and much more.
is the most popular scripting language on the internet, and works in all major browsers, such as Internet Explorer, Mozilla, Firefox, Netscape, Opera.
are used to store data
is a "container" for information you want to store, also its value can change during the script. You can refer to a variable by name to see its value or to change its value.
give all assignment operators in javascript (should be in order and separated with comma ',' )
This symbol means equal to
This symbol means equal to (checks for both value and type)
Give all arithmetic operator (should be in order and separated with comma ',' )
Give all comparison operators (should be in order and separated with comma ',' )
Give all logical operators (should be in order and separated with comma ',' )
is often used if you want to make sure information comes through to the user.
is often used if you want the user to verify or accept something.
is often used if you want the user to input a value before entering a page.
Give all conditional statements (should be in order and separated with comma ',' )
data.answer: if, if else,if else if else

data.question: _______ ______ - is a block of code designed to perform a particular task
A JavaScript function is executed when "something" _______ it or (calls it)
A JavaScript function is defined with the ______ keyword, followed by a name, followed by parentheses ().
True or False: Function names can contain letters, digits, underscores, and dollar signs

True or False: The parentheses may include parameter names separated by a colon:
(parameter1, parameter2, ...)
True or False: The code to be executed, by the function, is placed inside square brackets: []
______ ______ - are listed inside the parentheses () in the function definition.
Function ________ are the values received by the function when it is invoked.
When JavaScript reaches a _____ statement, the function will stop executing.
True or False: With a function, you can use the same code many times with different arguments, to produce different results.
The __ Operator Invokes the Function
True or False: Scripts cannot be placed in the body, or in the head section of an HTML page, or in both.
Write True if the syntax is correct Else Write False
True or False: You can place a limited amount of Script inside your HTML files
